intro: Dombeya ankazobeensis, commonly known as the Ankazobe dombeya, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in moist, forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
